message.content:
Below is one possible reading of the scene that matches the blocks (including their “no‐rotate” orientations) as shown in your second image:

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  OVERALL LAYOUT AND LAYERS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
•  There are two separate “mini‐structures.”

•  Left Structure (4 blocks total, stacked roughly three layers high):
   – Bottom: one red arch block.  
   – Middle: one blue cube plus a yellow half‐cylinder attached at the side.
   – Top: one orange “roof” wedge.

•  Right Structure (6 blocks total, two layers of red arches bridged by yellow bars):
   – Bottom Layer: two red arch blocks side by side.  
   – Middle Layer: two yellow rectangular bars that span front‐to‐back, forming a yellow “band.”  
   – Top Layer: two more red arch blocks, aligned above the bottom pair.

In total, 10 blocks are used across both constructions.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  BLOCK‐DICTIONARY SELECTION
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Below are the dictionary indices (from your second image) that match each piece **without rotating** them differently than shown:

 • Left Structure
    1. Red arch “base” → block index 2  
    2. Blue cube → block index 6  
    3. Yellow half‐cylinder → block index 10  
    4. Orange roof wedge → block index 16  

 • Right Structure
    – Four red arches (two bottom + two top) → all block index 2  
    – Two yellow rectangular bars spanning the center → both block index 9  

Hence the needed indices are:  
{2, 6, 10, 16, 9} with multiple repeats of 2 and 9 as indicated above.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
A sample build order (placing the left structure first, then the right):

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 2   (left‐structure red arch base)
  Step2:  Move block with index 6   (blue cube on arch)
  Step3:  Move block with index 10  (yellow half‐cylinder at side)
  Step4:  Move block with index 16  (orange roof on top)

  Step5:  Move block with index 2   (right‐structure bottom‐left red arch)
  Step6:  Move block with index 2   (right‐structure bottom‐right red arch)
  Step7:  Move block with index 9   (first yellow bar across the middle)
  Step8:  Move block with index 9   (second yellow bar behind the first)
  Step9:  Move block with index 2   (top‐left red arch)
  Step10: Move block with index 2   (top‐right red arch)
}

Following the above selection and order will reproduce the target scene exactly as shown.
